did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, Financial Records, Legal Documents, Photographs
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Office correspondence, bills, receipts, contracts, job indexes, photographs, blueprints, and detail drawings

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence consists of both outgoing (51 letter impression books, 1899-1926) and incoming letters (131 letterboxes, ca. 1892-ca. 1931) to and from clients, contractors, and supply companies in regard to the design and construction of schools, churches, private homes, apartment houses, commercial establishments, hospitals, public buildings, and other structures in New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania, including the stairs and stone walls at Watkins Glen (1908), the Arnot Art Gallery, the Corning Glass Works, Cortland County and Arnot-Ogden Hospitals, the Elmira College Library, Elmira Y.M.C.A. and Masonic Temple, and the Elmira Free Academy; also, bills, receipts, contracts, indexes (2 volumes) of jobs, and various photographs, blueprints, and detail drawings.

controlaccess.head: Places:
controlaccess.geogname: New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania - Buildings.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Pierce and Bickford records, #2299. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. 51 Letterbooks - Copies of Outgoing Correspondence, 1899 - 1926
Volumes 16-22, 24-65, 68

Series II. Incoming letters, bills, receipts and related items
Boxes 1-131

Series III. Job file drawings, #5-1791
Box 133-148, 153; Mapcase Folders 1-18
This series is arranged alphabetically by the location of the job: first by state, then by city, and finally by the name of the project.
Plans for related buildings have often been grouped together.

p.ref: 1. Roselle Park, NJ; Albany - Eddytown, NY

arrangement.p:
Series IV. Recent correspondence, Bickford genealogy, photographs, printed material
Box 149

Series V. Job Index, Photographs, Cartoons etc.
Box 150

Series VI. Glass slides, Printing blocks, Glass plate negatives, etc.
Box 132, 151

scopecontent.p:
Fifty-one MSS. volumes of letterbooks containing copies of the outgoing correspondence
of the architectural firm of Pierce & Bickford of Elmira, New York.
Includes letters to clients,as well as to contractors and supply companies, in regard
to the design and construction of buildings in New York, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey.
Among the outstanding jobs are:

did.unittitle: Church and Main Streets, Elmira, for Mrs. Julia Reynolds. See correspondence in Volume (Letterbook) 17
National Protective Legion Building, Waverly, N. Y.
Y. M. C. A, Geneva, N. Y.

scopecontent.p: Note on cover: From July 17, 1913: Bills paid

scopecontent.p: Also contains a contract dated December 1896
